label: 伝奏
本: Court and Bakufu in Japan:  Essays in Kamakura History . Stanford University Press . 1982
説明文: Liaison officials who transmitted petitions from the civil and religious nobility to the retired emperor. A title dating back to late Heian times, densō came to occupy one or two seats on the ex-sovereign's hyōjōshū, established in 1246. Densō also came to be used by the emperor Go-Daigo during the Kemmu Restoration.　[評定衆、後醍醐天皇、建武]
